name: Alluvial fan
description: Stream deposit of loose rock material where it issues from a narrow mountain valley upon a plain.

name: Playa
description: Undrained desert basin in which water accumulates and is quickly evaporated.

name: Stream channel
description: Bed in which a natural stream of water runs.

name: Local depression
description: An area that has no external surface drainage.

name: Dunes
description: Mounds and ridges of windblown, or eolian sand.

name: Flat surface
description: May be part of a larger feature, such as a plateau, plain, or pediment.

name: Flood plain
description: Smooth land surface adjacent to a river channel that is flooded when the river overflows its banks.

name: Hilltop
description: Upper part of a hill or ridge above a well-defined break in slope.

name: Sinkhole
description: Depression that results from the dissolving of soluble rocks and collapse into the solution cavity.

name: Lake or Swamp
description: Inland lake, swamp, or marsh where the ground may be saturated or water stands above the land surface.

name: Mangrove swamp
description: Tropical or subtropical marine swamp characterized by abundant mangrove trees.

name: Offshore
description: Site along a coast or estuary that is continuously submerged.

name: Pediment
description: Plain of combined erosion and deposition that forms at the foot of a mountain range.

name: Hillside
description: Sloping side of hill, the area between the hilltop and valley flat.

name: Alluvial terrace
description: Generally a flat surface, usually parallel to but elevated above a stream valley or coast line.

name: Undulating
description: Topography is characteristic of areas which have many small depressions and low mounds.

name: Valley flat
description: Low flat area between the valley walls and bordering a stream channel.
